title: Installation issue: petsc4py ^python@3:
body:
The following (from https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/275#issuecomment-166987195) allows a user to install python 2 and 3 versions of packages, e.g.
```
$ spack install py-scipy
$ spack install py-scipy ^python@3:
```
installs python 2 and 3 versions of scipy.

But the same approach fails to install a python 3 version of petsc4py:
```
$ spack install py-petsc4py ^python@3:
==> Error: An unsatisfiable version constraint has been detected for spec:

    python@3.4:
        ^bzip2
            ^diffutils
        ^ncurses
            ^pkgconfig
        ^openssl
            ^perl@5.14.0:
                ^gdbm
                    ^readline
            ^zlib
        ^sqlite


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    petsc+mpi
        ^blas
        ^lapack
        ^mpi


petsc requires python version 2.6:2.8, but spec asked for 3.4:
```
The problem is that petsc can only be built using python 2 but petsc4py obviously requires python 3 as requested. Perhaps there is a bug where petsc's build only python dependency:
```
    depends_on('python@2.6:2.8', type='build')
```
is propagated outside of just the build environment?

EDIT: I guess I didn't search hard enough as this seems to be a known issue:
- https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/7926
- https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/2548
- https://github.com/spack/spack/pull/8018
